issue.title: Amplify Pull Always Failed in Xcode Run Script

labels.name: transferred
labels.description: This issue was transferred from another Amplify project

issue.body:
### How did you install the Amplify CLI? curl -sL https://aws-amplify.github.io/amplify-cli/install | bash ### If applicable, what version of Node.js are you using? v18.16.0 ### Amplify CLI Version 12.1.1 ### What operating system are you using? Mac ### Did you make any manual changes to the cloud resources managed by Amplify? Please describe the changes made. no i use default model (todo) ### Describe the bug I have an Xcode project that will implement Amplify GraphQL, and I intend to pull the schema and regenerate the queries every time the application is built to obtain the latest schema. And this script works as desired when run in a regular terminal. However, when I run it as an Xcode run script, I always encounter errors. Here is the bash.script And I found that the amplify pull command is causing the error, while the amplify codegen command runs normally when I comment out amplify pull. ``` set -e cd ${PROJECT_DIR} # Run Amplify commands amplify="/Users/.amplify/bin/amplify" IFS='|' # Check if Amplify CLI is installed if ! command -v "$amplify" &>/dev/null; then echo "Amplify CLI not found. Installing..." if ! curl -sL https://aws-amplify.github.io/amplify-cli/install | bash; then echo "Failed to install Amplify CLI." fi else echo "Amplify CLI found." fi CODEGEN="{\ \"generateCode\":true,\ \"codeLanguage\":\"swift\",\ \”fileNamePattern\”:\”graphql/**/*.graphql\”,\ \"generatedFileName\":\"API\",\ \"generateDocs\":true\, \”maxDepth\”:2\ }" SWIFTCONFIG="{\ \"SourceDir\":\"src\",\ \"XcodeProject\":\"MyProject.xcodeproj\",\ \"BuildCommand\":\"xcodebuild\",\ \"StartCommand\":\"swift run\"\ }" AWSCLOUDFORMATIONCONFIG="{\ \"configLevel\":\"project\",\ \"useProfile\":false,\ \"profileName\":\"default\",\ \"accessKeyId\":\"xxxxx\",\ \"secretAccessKey\":\"xxxxxxxx+\",\ \"region\":\"us-east-1\"\ }" AMPLIFY="{\ \"projectName\":\"xxxx\",\ \"appId\":\"xxxxx\",\ \"envName\":\"dev\",\ \"defaultEditor\":\"xcode\"\ }" FRONTEND="{\ \"frontend\":\"ios\" }" PROVIDERS="{\ \"awscloudformation\":$AWSCLOUDFORMATIONCONFIG\ }" # Run Amplify pull command environment="" # Set the environment based on the CONFIGURATION variable if [ "$CONFIGURATION" == "Production" ]; then environment="dev" echo "Current environment: Production" elif [ "$CONFIGURATION" == "Staging" ]; then environment="dev" echo "Current environment: Staging" else environment="dev" echo "Invalid environment. Exiting." exit 1 fi echo "Fetching changes from backend..." "$amplify" pull \ --yes \ --debug \ --restore \ --amplify "$AMPLIFY" \ --frontend "$FRONTEND" \ --providers "$PROVIDERS" # Check if Amplify pull succeeded if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo "Amplify pull succeeded." else echo "Amplify pull failed. Check the error logs for more information." exit 1 fi # ReGenerate code model, schema, and query "$amplify" codegen \ --config "$CODEGEN" \ --statements \ --model \ --yes # Check if code generation succeeded if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo "Code generation succeeded." else echo "Code generation failed. Check the error logs for more information." exit 1 fi echo "Amplify project configured for iOS." ``` This is the error ### Expected behavior - amplify pull works pefectly fine in run script ### Reproduction steps - add script to build phase, before compile sources - add this code - and build will failed ### Project Identifier _No response_ ### Log output
``` # Put your logs below this line ```

pull_request.title: fix(Analytics): Fixing crash when attempting to submit events while a previous submission is in progress
pull_request.body:
## Issue \#
- https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-swift/issues/3328

## Description
This PR fixes a crash that was happening when `EventRecorder.submitAllEvents()` was called while a previous submission was still ongoing.
This happened because the `submittedEvents` array was being populated by the previous submission, while the very first thing a new one does is to set it to `[]`.

I am changing the behaviour so that `submitAllEvents` now waits until the previous submission ends before continuing. I've explored just using a lock to manipulate the array instead, but while that did fix the crash, it would still produce undetermined behaviour when the array was emptied.

## General Checklist

- [ ] Added new tests to cover change, if needed
- [ ] Build succeeds with all target using Swift Package Manager
- [X] All unit tests pass
- [ ] All integration tests pass
- [ ] Security oriented best practices and standards are followed (e.g. using input sanitization, principle of least privilege, etc)
- [ ] Documentation update for the change if required
- [ ] PR title conforms to conventional commit style
- [ ] New or updated tests include `Given When Then` inline code documentation and are named accordingly `testThing_condition_expectation()`
- [ ] If breaking change, documentation/changelog update with migration instructions

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

comment.body:
I was able to reproduce this when `Amplify.Analytics.flushEvents()` is called while a previous event submission is still ongoing. This could happen due to different factors, such as: many events in the local database, slow connectivity, small auto flush interval, or a combination of them.

In any case, I'm working on a fix.

issue.title: feat(core): update swift-sdk dependency to 0.29.0
issue.body:
## Description
Updates dependency on AWS SDK for Swift from 0.26.0 to 0.29.0. 
This is needed to pull in changes released in 0.29.0 that removed a compiler error when building for visionOS.
Once this update lands in `main`, it will need to be pulled into the `visionos-preview` branch.

- Renames SDK response types from `*OutputResponse` to `*Output`.
- Restructures to Auth test harness to work around SDK `*OutputError` types becoming internal.
- Adds some missing methods to `*ClientProtocol` conformances in Predictions unit test suite.

## TODO
- [ ] Ensure that Storage presignedURL change works as expected.

## General Checklist

issue.title: Unable to sign in using Federated Identity Provider Azure-AD through signInWithWebUI
issue.body:
### Describe the bug Hello Amplify Team, I'm unable to use the amplify-cli due to my level of access, so I have created the `amplifyconfiguration.json` according to the documentation listed here: [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/getting-started/q/platform/ios/#prerequisites](https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/getting-started/q/platform/ios/#prerequisites) Here is my config: ``` { "auth": { "plugins": { "awsCognitoAuthPlugin": { "IdentityManager": { "Default": {} }, "CognitoUserPool": { "Default": { "PoolId": "[POOL ID]", "AppClientId": "[APP CLIENT ID]", "AppClientSecret": "[APP CLIENT SECRET]", "Region": "[REGION]" } }, "Auth": { "Default": { "authenticationFlowType": "USER_SRP_AUTH", "OAuth": { "WebDomain": "https://[ENV]-[APP NAME].auth.[REGION].amazoncognito.com", "AppClientId": "[CLIENT ID]", "SignInRedirectURI": "myapp://", "SignOutRedirectURI": "myapp://", "Scopes": [ "email", "openid" ], "ResponseType": "code" } } } } } } } ``` Inside my application, this is how I'm calling `signInWithWebUI` : ```swift func socialSignInWithWebUI(window: UIWindow) async { do { let signInResult = try await Amplify.Auth.signInWithWebUI(for: .saml("Azure-AD"), presentationAnchor: window) if(signInResult.isSignedIn) { print("Sign in succeeded.") } } catch let error { print("Unexpected error: \(error)") } } ``` I looked through documentation to see if I'm even using the right approach (that is, using `signInWithWebUI`) and I found these pages referring to federation identities: - Identity Pool Federation (Advanced Workflows): [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/advanced/q/platform/ios/](https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/advanced/q/platform/ios/) - Federated Identities [https://docs.amplify.aws/sdk/auth/federated-identities/q/platform/ios/](https://docs.amplify.aws/sdk/auth/federated-identities/q/platform/ios/) The last reference being a little older but the issue is that I'm not using an Identity Pool - is it required in this scenario? I wasn't able to find any concrete information about this. Lastly, accessing the Hosted UI through the console works just fine and so does Postman when I set up the `Authorization` section and filled in the proper values. If I could please receive some assistance regarding this issue it would be greatly appreciated - thank you. ### Steps To Reproduce ```swift Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create a Cognito User Pool 2. Create a Federated Identity Provider of type SAML 3. Create an app client with an app client secret 4. Create a Hosted UI with the IdP and appropriate callback URLs 5. Set up an amplifyconfiguration.json without using the amplify cli 6. Call the signInWithWebUI api ``` ### Expected behavior I expect for a modal view to open and display the Hosted UI I'm seeing in the desktop browsers I've tested in, so that the user can enter in their credentials in Azure and be redirected according to the URL Scheme I've designated. ### Amplify Framework Version 2.16.0 ### Amplify Categories Auth ### Dependency manager Swift PM ### Swift version 5 ### CLI version N/A ### Xcode version 15.0.1 (15A507) ### Relevant log output ```shell
Log Messages 2023-10-25 21:43:22.897470-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Configuring 2023-10-25 21:43:22.924388-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Could not find Cognito Identity Pool configuration 2023-10-25 21:43:22.937836-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Successfully initialized Amplify ```
``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Regression additional context _No response_ ### Platforms iOS ### OS Version iOS 16.0 ### Device iPhone 14 Pro Max ### Specific to simulators iPhone 13 Pro Simulator ### Additional context I'm receiving this popup once the api call is triggered: This is the modal that appears once I proceed:

comment.body: @dsakhapo Thanks for the feedback.  We'll add to our backlogs work items to update our documentation and template.  We recommend to use Amplify CLI to manage your configuration when possible so that all configurations are configured properly via the CLI questionnaires based on your use case and avoid typo and other errors that could be introduced through manual edits.

```swift
Reproduction steps following this exactly with Xcode 15 beta 1.0:

comment.body:
As of Xcode 15 beta 6, `#if os(iOS)` no longer evaluates as true for visionOS.
As an immediate workaround, you can use Xcode 15 beta 1 through beta 5.

AWS SDK for Swift released version [0.29.0](https://github.com/awslabs/aws-sdk-swift/releases/tag/0.29.0) yesterday (10/26/23), which addresses this.

We're working on pulling those updates into `main` and subsequently into `visionos-preview`. 
We'll continue to post updates here.

issue.title: Unable to sign in using Federated Identity Provider Azure-AD through signInWithWebUI
issue.body:
### Describe the bug Hello Amplify Team, I'm unable to use the amplify-cli due to my level of access, so I have created the `amplifyconfiguration.json` according to the documentation listed here: [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/getting-started/q/platform/ios/#prerequisites](url) Here is my config: ``` { "auth": { "plugins": { "awsCognitoAuthPlugin": { "IdentityManager": { "Default": {} }, "CognitoUserPool": { "Default": { "PoolId": "[POOL ID]", "AppClientId": "[APP CLIENT ID]", "AppClientSecret": "[APP CLIENT SECRET]", "Region": "[REGION]" } }, "Auth": { "Default": { "authenticationFlowType": "USER_SRP_AUTH", "OAuth": { "WebDomain": "https://[ENV]-[APP NAME].auth.[REGION].amazoncognito.com", "AppClientId": "[CLIENT ID]", "SignInRedirectURI": "myapp://", "SignOutRedirectURI": "myapp://", "Scopes": [ "email", "openid" ], "ResponseType": "code" } } } } } } } ``` Inside my application, this is how I'm calling `signInWithWebUI` : ```swift func socialSignInWithWebUI(window: UIWindow) async { do { let signInResult = try await Amplify.Auth.signInWithWebUI(for: .saml("Azure-AD"), presentationAnchor: window) if(signInResult.isSignedIn) { print("Sign in succeeded.") } } catch let error { print("Unexpected error: \(error)") } } ``` I looked through documentation to see if I'm even using the right approach (that is, using `signInWithWebUI`) and I found these pages referring to federation identities: - Identity Pool Federation (Advanced Workflows): [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/advanced/q/platform/ios/](url) - Federated Identities [https://docs.amplify.aws/sdk/auth/federated-identities/q/platform/ios/](url) The last reference being a little older but the issue is that I'm not using an Identity Pool - is it required in this scenario? I wasn't able to find any concrete information about this. Lastly, accessing the Hosted UI through the console works just fine and so does Postman when I set up the `Authorization` section and filled in the proper values. If I could please receive some assistance regarding this issue it would be greatly appreciated - thank you. ### Steps To Reproduce ```swift Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create a Cognito User Pool 2. Create a Federated Identity Provider of type SAML 3. Create an app client with an app client secret 4. Create a Hosted UI with the IdP and appropriate callback URLs 5. Set up an amplifyconfiguration.json without using the amplify cli 6. Call the signInWithWebUI api ``` ### Expected behavior I expect for a modal view to open and display the Hosted UI I'm seeing in the desktop browsers I've tested in, so that the user can enter in their credentials in Azure and be redirected according to the URL Scheme I've designated. ### Amplify Framework Version 2.16.0 ### Amplify Categories Auth ### Dependency manager Swift PM ### Swift version 5 ### CLI version N/A ### Xcode version 15.0.1 (15A507) ### Relevant log output ```shell
Log Messages 2023-10-25 21:43:22.897470-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Configuring 2023-10-25 21:43:22.924388-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Could not find Cognito Identity Pool configuration 2023-10-25 21:43:22.937836-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Successfully initialized Amplify ```
``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Regression additional context _No response_ ### Platforms iOS ### OS Version iOS 16.0 ### Device iPhone 14 Pro Max ### Specific to simulators iPhone 13 Pro Simulator ### Additional context I'm receiving this popup once the api call is triggered: This is the modal that appears once I proceed:

issue.title: Unable to sign in using Federated Identity Provider Azure-AD through signInWithWebUI
issue.body:
### Describe the bug Hello Amplify Team, I'm unable to use the amplify-cli due to my level of access, so I have created the `amplifyconfiguration.json` according to the documentation listed here: [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/getting-started/q/platform/ios/#prerequisites](url) Here is my config: ``` { "auth": { "plugins": { "awsCognitoAuthPlugin": { "IdentityManager": { "Default": {} }, "CognitoUserPool": { "Default": { "PoolId": "[POOL ID]", "AppClientId": "[APP CLIENT ID]", "AppClientSecret": "[APP CLIENT SECRET]", "Region": "[REGION]" } }, "Auth": { "Default": { "authenticationFlowType": "USER_SRP_AUTH", "OAuth": { "WebDomain": "https://[ENV]-[APP NAME].auth.[REGION].amazoncognito.com", "AppClientId": "[CLIENT ID]", "SignInRedirectURI": "myapp://", "SignOutRedirectURI": "myapp://", "Scopes": [ "email", "openid" ], "ResponseType": "code" } } } } } } } ``` Inside my application, this is how I'm calling `signInWithWebUI` : ```swift func socialSignInWithWebUI(window: UIWindow) async { do { let signInResult = try await Amplify.Auth.signInWithWebUI(for: .saml("Azure-AD"), presentationAnchor: window) if(signInResult.isSignedIn) { print("Sign in succeeded.") } } catch let error { print("Unexpected error: \(error)") } } ``` I looked through documentation to see if I'm even using the right approach (that is, using `signInWithWebUI`) and I found these pages referring to federation identities: - Identity Pool Federation (Advanced Workflows): [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/advanced/q/platform/ios/](url) - Federated Identities [https://docs.amplify.aws/sdk/auth/federated-identities/q/platform/ios/](url) The last reference being a little older but the issue is that I'm not using an Identity Pool - is it required in this scenario? I wasn't able to find any concrete information about this. Lastly, accessing the Hosted UI through the console works just fine and so does Postman when I set up the `Authorization` section and filled in the proper values. If I could please receive some assistance regarding this issue it would be greatly appreciated - thank you. ### Steps To Reproduce ```swift Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create a Cognito User Pool 2. Create a Federated Identity Provider of type SAML 3. Create an app client with an app client secret 4. Create a Hosted UI with the IdP and appropriate callback URLs 5. Set up an amplifyconfiguration.json without using the amplify cli 6. Call the signInWithWebUI api ``` ### Expected behavior I expect for a modal view to open and display the Hosted UI I'm seeing in the desktop browsers I've tested in, so that the user can enter in their credentials in Azure and be redirected according to the URL Scheme I've designated. ### Amplify Framework Version 2.16.0 ### Amplify Categories Auth ### Dependency manager Swift PM ### Swift version 5 ### CLI version N/A ### Xcode version 15.0.1 (15A507) ### Relevant log output ```shell
Log Messages 2023-10-25 21:43:22.897470-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Configuring 2023-10-25 21:43:22.924388-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Could not find Cognito Identity Pool configuration 2023-10-25 21:43:22.937836-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Successfully initialized Amplify ```
``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Regression additional context _No response_ ### Platforms iOS ### OS Version iOS 16.0 ### Device iPhone 14 Pro Max ### Specific to simulators iPhone 13 Pro Simulator ### Additional context I'm receiving this popup once the api call is triggered: This is the modal that appears once I proceed:

issue.title: Unable to sign in using Federated Identity Provider Azure-AD through signInWithWebUI
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hello Amplify Team,

I'm unable to use the amplify-cli due to my level of access, so I have created the `amplifyconfiguration.json` according to the documentation listed here:  [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/getting-started/q/platform/ios/#prerequisites](url)

Here is my config:

```
{
  "auth": {
    "plugins": {
      "awsCognitoAuthPlugin": {
        "IdentityManager": {
          "Default": {}
        },
        "CognitoUserPool": {
          "Default": {
            "PoolId": "[POOL ID]",
            "AppClientId": "[APP CLIENT ID]",
            "AppClientSecret": "[APP CLIENT SECRET]",
            "Region": "[REGION]"
          }
        },
        "Auth": {
          "Default": {
            "authenticationFlowType": "USER_SRP_AUTH",
            "OAuth": {
              "WebDomain": "https://[ENV]-[APP NAME].auth.[REGION].amazoncognito.com",
              "AppClientId": "[CLIENT ID]",
              "SignInRedirectURI": "myapp://",
              "SignOutRedirectURI": "myapp://",
              "Scopes": [
                "email",
                "openid"
              ],
              "ResponseType": "code"
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Inside my application, this is how I'm calling `signInWithWebUI` :

```swift
func socialSignInWithWebUI(window: UIWindow) async {
        do {
            let signInResult = try await Amplify.Auth.signInWithWebUI(for: .saml("Azure-AD"), presentationAnchor: window)
            if(signInResult.isSignedIn) {
                print("Sign in succeeded.")
            }
        } catch let error {
            print("Unexpected error: \(error)")
        }
}
```

I looked through documentation to see if I'm even using the right approach (that is, using `signInWithWebUI`) and I found these pages referring to federation identities:

- Identity Pool Federation (Advanced Workflows): [https://docs.amplify.aws/lib/auth/advanced/q/platform/ios/](url)
- Federated Identities [https://docs.amplify.aws/sdk/auth/federated-identities/q/platform/ios/](url)

The last reference being a little older but the issue is that I'm not using an Identity Pool - is it required in this scenario? I wasn't able to find any concrete information about this.

Lastly, accessing the Hosted UI through the console works just fine and so does Postman when I set up the `Authorization` section and filled in the proper values.

If I could please receive some assistance regarding this issue it would be greatly appreciated - thank you.



### Steps To Reproduce

```swift
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a Cognito User Pool
2. Create a Federated Identity Provider of type SAML
3. Create an app client with an app client secret
4. Create a Hosted UI with the IdP and appropriate callback URLs
5. Set up an amplifyconfiguration.json without using the amplify cli
6. Call the signInWithWebUI api
```


### Expected behavior

I expect for a modal view to open and display the Hosted UI I'm seeing in the desktop browsers I've tested in, so that the user can enter in their credentials in Azure and be redirected according to the URL Scheme I've designated.

### Amplify Framework Version

2.16.0

### Amplify Categories

Auth

### Dependency manager

Swift PM

### Swift version

5

### CLI version

N/A

### Xcode version

15.0.1 (15A507)

### Relevant log output

```shell
<details>
<summary>Log Messages</summary>


2023-10-25 21:43:22.897470-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Configuring
2023-10-25 21:43:22.924388-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Could not find Cognito Identity Pool configuration
2023-10-25 21:43:22.937836-0700 AppName[47208:3645645] [Amplify] Successfully initialized Amplify
```
</details>
```


### Is this a regression?

No

### Regression additional context

_No response_

### Platforms

iOS

### OS Version

iOS 16.0

### Device

iPhone 14 Pro Max

### Specific to simulators

iPhone 13 Pro Simulator

### Additional context

_No response_
